why_it_matters: The most common indication for the prescribing of doxycyline in primary care
is the treatment of respiratory-tract infections. NICE guidance recommends for example that, where doxycycline is used for cough, the dose is
200mg on the first day, then 100mg once a day for 4 days (5-day course in total).
Where greater than 5 days treatment is prescribed for these indications, this increases both the unnecessary prescribing of antibiotics, as well as cost.
There are however some indications which require higher doses/longer durations of doxycycline for example, treatment of infected leg ulcers.
